faq.name: criticalerror
faq.que: When running ∓ appear a lot of message errors, or program crashes.
faq.ans: Wrong option values may cause errors, try to run program with the default options deleting the option file.

faq.name: somethingwrong
faq.que: Something is wrong, the program does not work: what happened?
faq.ans: ∓ keeps a log of his activity: trigger action and read its lines to understand what happened.

faq.name: nohelp
faq.que: In my system the ∓ help doesn't work.
faq.ans:
Maybe something is wrong with your HtmlHelp installation. The related files are:
%windir%\hh.exe %windir%\system32\hhctrl.ocx %windir%\system32\itss.dll %windir%\system32\itircl.dll
These files are considered as system files, so is not easy dealing with them. You can try to remove and reinstall &hhlib; doing something like:
@echo off title Remove and reinstall HH library rem download the HtmlHelp library distribution rem 'hhupd.exe' from http://msdn.microsoft.com rem and place it in the same dir of this file set prevdir=%CD% cd %windir%\system32 rem regsvr32 -u itcc.dll regsvr32 -u hhctrl.ocx del hhctrl.ocx del itss.dll del itircl.dll cd %prevdir% hhupd.exe

topic.name: problems_arguments
topic.title: Program arguments
topic.description: On arguments passed via command line

faq.name: commandlineerrors
faq.que: When using program passing arguments by command line something goes wrong; inspecting the Log the program complains.
faq.ans: See typical errors in directive section and the notes in program arguments section.

faq.name: readonlyoptions
faq.que: I can't modify the option file, or my changes are ignored.
faq.ans: Check the read-only flag and to use a support that allows writing. Remember that the option file has a fixed name and must be in the same directory of the executable; see option file section for further informations.

faq.name: fixplotfiles
faq.que: I can't open a plot file.
faq.ans: Maybe the file is corrupted, see the log to view the specific cause. The plot files are simply text files, so you can try to perform manual corrections.

faq.name: zipnotsupported
faq.keywords: cannot open or save a compressed file,zip,gz
faq.que: I can't open a compressed file, nor save plot as compressed archive!
faq.ans:
Make sure the &zlib; &API; &DLL; zlibwapi.dll is in path or at least in the ∓ directory. To see your path:
C:\> path
C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\PROGRA~1\ Borland\CBUILD~1\Projects\Bpl;C:\PROGRA~1\B orland\CBUILD~1\Bin;C:\Programmi\Subversion \bin;C:\Programmi\TortoiseSVN\bin

faq.name: droppingzone
faq.que: To open a file I drag and drop it in the plot area; why am I experience a different behaviour every time?
faq.ans: Pay attention on the zone you are releasing the file: if you release it on an existing &frame;, tracks will be added to it, otherwise a new frame will be created in the drop position.

faq.name: indexunit
faq.que: In header directive I can set index unit, but when I declare for example y(cm), the parser thinks that I want to plot y respect the missing column cm instead that y must be plotted respect line index measured in cm. What's the trick?
faq.ans: To declare a self contained independent variable you must use the unit braces: y([cm]). Remember that you can declare also a label: y(L[cm]). Take a look at the examples in the related section.

faq.name: mfilenotwork
faq.que: Launching from &matlab; an exported m-file named x it complains telling: ??? Undefined function or variable 'x'.
faq.ans: Check &matlab; help about m-file valid names; avoid characters like +-*/ in the file name.

faq.name: losescale
faq.que: The plot sometimes change its scale forcing to manually restore the desired scale.
faq.ans: Take a look at plot keys description table: some of them involve a fit to current track, so to keep current scale you should avoid them.

faq.name: zoomreset
faq.que: Sometimes, when zooming with mouse left single clicks, the scale resets.
faq.ans: Check the zoom mode mouse clicks events, maybe left button double click cause frame to fit scale respect current track.

faq.name: nocoords
faq.que: I would like to see point coordinates using , but it does not work.
faq.ans: First ensure to select the correct &track; (see select mode and plot keys). Then try to zoom points: the coordinates are shown only when point distance is greater than the value set in option entry.

faq.name: optionmissing
faq.que: After program startup I see in the log a lot of lines like: Value `xxx´ in section `yyy´ is missing, using default: `zzz´. Is there something wrong in my system? How can I fix this?
faq.ans:
It is normal: as described in related section, initially no option file MattPlot.ini is present, so defaults are used. You can create a new one triggering
or actions.

faq.name: shortcutnotworking
faq.que: The keyboard shortcut set in option entries does not seem to work.
faq.ans: Be sure that the string represent a valid shortcut; refer to key codes table to see the correct key strings.

faq.name: fontignored
faq.que: Modifying a Font in the option file my changes are ignored.
faq.ans: Ensure to read options using . If the Font family is not recognized, windows substitutes it with a default; check your option entry in the option file.
